score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi is moderately congested, impacting performance, especially on the 2.4GHz band.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload improved, ping worsened, networks increased.

latest_report.diagnosis: Random dropouts are likely due to network congestion and interference. The 2.4GHz band is particularly affected.

performance.interpretation: Download speeds are good, but the upload speed is below average. The ping time indicates some latency, which may contribute to dropouts.

problems: High number of competing networks (17 total).
Congestion on the 2.4GHz band, especially channels 1 and 11.
Possible interference from nearby devices operating on similar channels.
Low RSSI on several devices indicating weak connectivity.
fixes: Switch 2.4GHz channel to 1 or 11 (recommend channel 11 due to better RSSI).
Change 5GHz channel to 149 (recommended to avoid interference from 36).
Consider moving the router from the bedroom window to a more central location.
Enable band steering to allow devices to use the less congested 5GHz band.
Limit the number of devices on the 2.4GHz band to reduce congestion.
Regularly reboot the router to refresh connections and clear cache.
